title: Mighty God, While Angels Bless Thee

verses.html:
1
Mighty God, while angels bless Thee,
May a mortal sing Thy name?
Lord of men as well as angels,
Thou art ev’ry creature’s theme.

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
Lord of ev’ry land and nation,
Ancient of eternal days,
Sounded through the wide creation
Be Thy just and endless praise.

2
For the grandeur of Thy nature,
Grand beyond a seraph’s thought;
For the wonders of creation;
Works with skill and kindness wrought.

verses.label: 2C
verses.html:
2
For Thy providence, that governs,
Thro’ Thine empire’s wide domain,
Wings an angel, guides a sparrow,
Blessed be Thy gentle reign.

3
But Thy rich, Thy free redemption,
Bright, tho’ veiled in darkness long;
Thought is poor, and poor expression;
Who can sing that wondrous song?

verses.label: 3C
verses.html:
3
Brightness of the Father’s glory,
Shall Thy praise unuttered lie?
Break, my tongue, such guilty silence!
Sing the Lord who came to die.

4
From the highest throne of glory
To the cross of deepest woe,
All to ransom guilty captives;
Flow my praise, forever flow!

verses.label: 4C
verses.html:
4
Reascend, immortal Saviour;
Leave Thy footstool, take Thy throne;
Thence return, and reign forever,
Be the kingdom all Thine own!
